meanings.sent1: The shiny new bike belonged to my brother.
meanings.sent2: The old book belonged to the library.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy belonged to the friendly dog next door.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful melody belonged to the wind, carrying it far away.
meanings.sent5: The precious necklace belonged to the queen, shining brightly.

meanings.definition: To be a member of a group or organization
meanings.sent1: I belonged to the school choir last year.
meanings.sent2: She belonged to the hiking club for many years.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten belonged to the group of troublemakers.
meanings.sent4: His heart belonged to the team, always supporting them.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower belonged to the garden club, blooming beautifully.

meanings.definition: To be in the right place or situation
meanings.sent1: The missing puzzle piece belonged in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The key belonged in the lock, opening the door.
meanings.sent3: The lost sock belonged in the drawer, hiding from its pair.
meanings.sent4: Her smile belonged in the room, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The final piece belonged in the jigsaw puzzle, completing the picture.
